350C8D42613B450B8B9A8319E4C17424.description: describe the role of molecular evolution

295434D4847A495EAA29270D47A71DD7.description: explain the genetics of populations, including genotypic frequencies and allelic frequencies, Hardy-Weinberg, variation in natural populations, and forces that change gene frequencies

FF764CE5682640B4865F6EA9E91FF2F2.description: define and give examples of chromosomal mutations and chromosomal changes

BE14050A0DD246D38683D0891C61641C.description: define and give examples of transposable elements and transposition in prokaryotes and eukaryotes

8ED0421756FA450385383E2062ED7E82.description: identify genetic changes, including DNA mutation and repair, human genetic diseases, and the detection of mutations

D2A612D3AEC4450399D363EB75EA6C98.description: explain how eukaryotic genes are regulated

593A42D5D907499BB070E2A93ECA99B9.description: explain the role of operons and their regulation

3447997692444388AF356FE2AD0A12AD.description: identify the genetics of cancer and the relationship of the cell cycle to cancer

9535AA5F3DC344CAADEF061EC1D76341.description: analyze mono/dihybrid crosses, probability, and pedigree analysis

C58DBB5F64D24FB1BE0CD2C648EB1699.description: identify the history and the role of Mendelian genetics in the study and advancement of the field of genetics

E586927AD8714175BB5E47B34EBFEE2F.description: discuss the ethical and legal implications of recombinant DNA technology

0E63B2E0F96A443DA0FC95F299E02317.description: explain gene analysis, including gene sequencing, functional genomics, and comparative genomics

7D309F991C594EC78E22B4ECA0F91A5E.description: explain the applications of recombinant technology including testing for gene mutations, isolating human genes, and DNA identification

10FF37FDC2AD4D84A153F20D42DDD1BD.description: explain recombinant DNA technology, including cloning, DNA libraries, and enzyme restriction analysis

AD85E4C5414B48789A715E82CE428830.description: explain genetically based enzyme deficiencies and their historical significance

A7845EAF1D244E99AFC155BE0C2118D4.description: explain the discovery of gene control of protein structure

E679DD9A71F84E07842F95F7760D806D.description: describe DNA replication, including the mechanism of replication, the biochemistry of replication, prokaryotic replication, and eukaryotic replication

32865547BFA04FF4BD2E3F7D7E5F9C32.description: describe DNA as genetic material and define the organization of DNA in chromosomes

2E1184DB2D1D4AD5B0700C33D0D855F0.description: discuss the importance of curiosity, honesty, openness, and skepticism in science and exhibit these traits in efforts to understand how the world works

82A3078B6B2645B384CC2B4299FE5544.description: by the end of grade 12, read and comprehend science/technical texts in the grades 11-12 text complexity band independently and proficiently

A37A6DB4C4074114A96FA86FFA0180A6.description: analyze how the text structures information or ideas into categories or hierarchies, demonstrating understanding of the information or ideas

E8A6018140554240A691CF2C21E2C46A.description: determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and other domain-specific words and phrases as they are used in a specific scientific or technical context relevant to grades 11-12 texts and topics

BA4F491C80A446D6ADBD2630086E3B59.description: examine relationship between life experiences and subject area content

133B707056B24898A5DF583EA6651ABB.description: apply strategies for determining content and contextual meaning for unknown words

63CB37C80C374AAFB8270C970924693C.description: use content vocabulary in writing and speaking

102717B7880A4D208DF54B1DE4C4C6E8.description: examine the features of disciplinary texts

67AAB44EF1364B3989377268E006B5B5.description: analyze the author's purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text, identifying important issues that remain unresolved

3A9FA66DECB24334904ABD07EEAD7E34.description: evaluate the hypotheses, data, analysis, and conclusions in a science or technical text, verifying the data when possible and corroborating or challenging conclusions with other sources of information

ECDB6200F9BE4705BF5D4325FC188ED7.description: respond to text, using multiple modes of discourse

907605E95625442EAE176E4D52485448.description: discuss messages and themes from text and relate to other subject areas

19A23632502F420AAAE980C49740B918.description: determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; summarize complex concepts, processes, or information presented in a text by paraphrasing them in simpler, but still accurate, terms

5F6A52B5840A4E679D17315C8C89EF7C.description: read technical text related to various subject areas

3EED921DD9B34ED090A7835B09257740.description: read grade-level appropriate text (both informational and fictional) from a variety of genres and modes of discourse

60C531E9CD8C485690A4F0123E72C584.description: read scientific materials to establish context for subject matter, to develop vocabulary, and to be aware of current research

C4F11EBC982E4FA7A024471359BEBFE8.description: write routinely over extended time frames (time for reflection and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences

0969FB3F350347B09DCC3CCB95991008.description: gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using advanced searches effectively; assess the strengths and limitations of each source in terms of the specific task, purpose, and audience; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of ideas, avoiding plagiarism and overreliance on any one source and following a standard format for citation

3BC73DCE11B845BCA73FED973371B637.description: use technology, including the Internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products in response to ongoing feedback, including new arguments or information

A2DD85062EED4B6AA74E5119C7CC56F7.description: develop and strengthen writing, as needed, by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on addressing what is most significant for a specific purpose and audience

4563AE5EEE0D4BE58E513757778873EC.description: produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience

D306612173F74D85B73EA68DA5B5837A.description: integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., quantitative data, video, multimedia) in order to address a question or solve a problem

E7D2FFE411FB49C6B2146D5898C6D9B0.description: use peer reviews to analyze accuracy of scientific writings/reports

F5AB6468A9894BAD86A3D95A65493D03.description: participate in group discussions of scientific investigations and current scientific issues

5296EB7BA5EE49D79A4F8B849AB03D16.description: provide a concluding statement or section that follows from or supports the argument presented

EA133DC22A7A496DA8A86000A9672DB3.description: evaluate strengths and limitations of claims and counterclaims

76C951F1AEF84655BECB0D9273FA88D7.description: organize information in order to establish clear relationships between scientific arguments, reasons, and evidence

D5E106C7158D4988AFECF02E5EB6F3A9.description: in written or oral presentations, use evidence, including data, to support scientific arguments and claims, and present possible alternative interpretations

8766186BBAB6453B8156994BAFF2FC6B.description: provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic)

0FCB13BD23D64C3C83698A4D5D53B137.description: establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which one is writing

976109231121459D9C19658233C24128.description: use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to manage the complexity of the written topics and convey a style appropriate to the discipline and context as well as to the expertise of likely readers

2F036FA6A10D47688B5B93F14E5707D2.description: support written topics by using relevant facts, domain specific vocabulary and appropriate data representation (including graphics, tables, charts and figures to aid comprehension)

AD6D6F2B172C48159CFEEE5CB54F0EB0.description: develop written topics by organizing ideas, making important connections and linking and clarifying relationships

D5C0D6EF04C645509D720582320E6850.description: write clear, coherent accounts connecting scientific content including: procedures/experiments, current, and historical scientific issues

BCF4240A3F164CF5A9EBD71E7F84BFA3.description: write clear, coherent laboratory reports related to scientific investigations

48881AE5245A4C08AFDB69BFA297BA52.description: communicate scientific information, ideas, and arguments clearly

ED71847CB65147E4910D17E04ADF4BA0.description: compare and analyze data points graphically and/or summary statistics

B0DFF5F0F7E44A28B09738B332E11F4D.description: solve scientific problems by substituting quantitative values, using dimensional analysis and/or simple algebraic functions as appropriate

9FC566E4BC8E40B682C4679BFF355232.description: express the appropriate number of significant figures for calculated data, using scientific notation where appropriate

8DDD3C43749D482E9DDD42A9653AF4BA.description: explain the relationship between accuracy and precision

018A3615FBA04271B201FEEF0692EFE9.description: relate the number of significant figures to precision of measuring instrument

B8926448949F4996A6734C8C228D33CC.description: examine the possible effects of measurement errors on calculations

78D767E408344958BFF1D384963356C7.description: determine the source of large disparities between estimated and calculated results

03BF8BD6ED6D416299125AC47F88231D.description: apply computation and estimation skills necessary for analyzing data and developing conclusions

A2BBACA6977F4096A31AEFBC228A0B97.description: draw evidence from informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research

2849FEA464F443D88E94EB65B5130583.description: synthesize information from a range of sources (e.g., texts, experiments, simulations) into a coherent understanding of a process, phenomenon, or concept, resolving conflicting information when possible

179C54A9A7CF470AB2F31586AF5D0FBD.description: cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts, attending to important distinctions the author makes and to any gaps or inconsistencies in the account

C3B76ECDC31D46F294C3974F40FF5BF2.description: recognize the merit of a new theory is judged by how well scientific data are explained by the new theory

50863A08371842978DB3CC763E6EBF34.description: distinguish among laws, theories, and inferences

16D4D60ACA1D42EE8D84A4A0BC367781.description: assess the quality of data critically for possible sources of bias

6E669FF42B9A4FEFB053D888A50EE891.description: evaluate whether conclusions are reasonable by reviewing the process and checking against other available information

307B99B9A6B046CE9DD9BE41021D34DE.description: develop reasonable conclusions based on data collected

F2D5B01C80A6406FBC662519356A2F39.description: use valid critical assumptions to draw conclusions

3EC4C4C9A00A46A8A36D6CCD848ED644.description: use technology to develop, test, and revise experimental/mathematical models

B37359700E0E4B8A898F8E5BB066DF87.description: use graphical analysis software to produce tables/graphs and to determine constants in experiments

18238AFCF51E4DA5948D3F4E5E50F01D.description: develop and use systematic procedures for recording and organizing information

436C1BD75E424468BF346D9FBE490930.description: use technology to collect, observe, measure, and analyze data and report findings

3365B3E6F1554F11A230F8769B8FA99C.description: follow correct protocol for identifying and reporting safety problems and violations

313B97C07A6D485C9332385FAA1893AC.description: demonstrate appropriate techniques in all laboratory situations

DCEAF2EBA3304A498A60F2A475EE96E2.description: follow correct procedures for use of scientific apparatus

8841185D961741958F302163D6F52F28.description: apply standard safety practices for all classroom laboratory and field investigations

71AE6D5B1D664CE086F64CF4989AFC43.description: conduct short, as well as more sustained, research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question) or solve a problem; narrow or broaden the inquiry when appropriate; synthesize multiple sources on the subject, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation

CF88BECF1D36434C97E3EAD34FA7A1DC.description: follow precisely a complex multi-step procedure when carrying out experiments, taking measurements, or performing technical tasks; analyze the specific results based on explanations in the text

99DBCF30BCFB48348B950443763AC3AB.description: recognize science disciplines differ from one another in what is studied, techniques used, and outcomes sought

802B6D145A254DF39A515E22F2557A8F.description: examine the role of curiosity and skepticism in scientific investigation

DD1295251CE844538B320C5A50CE5459.description: recognize major shifts in scientific views typically occur after the observation of a new phenomenon or the interpretation of existing data

5458D6EC1508479197343D529A9EA833.description: recognize universal principles are discovered through observation and experimental verification and basic principles are the same everywhere (e.g., law of conservation of matter)

46A8CE9963CE4F6991407CA564FFF190.description: recognize testing, revising, and occasionally rejecting new and existing theories is a continuous process

5387024D065644F9BC1483D52B312535.description: explain further understanding of scientific problems relies on the design, and execution of new experiments may reinforce or weaken explanations

C5AD826DA1084EB193425FA994FE147F.description: recognize different explanations may be given for the same evidence

10E49C26F2A14B6C81F92DFAB4C8E1F2.description: collect, organize, and record appropriate data

5893C911F4E24C2084D7D4331B55420A.description: control the conditions of scientific investigations

5A338D95B671417FA64CF46E563229F7.description: develop procedures for solving scientific problems

EAB8C837A34E4403BE8B81A1D5B10AC6.description: recognize hypotheses often lead to the development of new experiments

172BD3B852C0459C9379712EA787B97F.description: identify, develop, and investigate questions/problems that can be answered through scientific inquiry
